text:
Digital Marketing Blog

Digital Marketing Case Studies, WhyTos, HowTos, Interviews, News, Events, Jobs and more...



Rate this post

Engineer by Education, Marketing Influencer by Profession, and Creative Writer by Passion- Shivendra is involved in Branding, Advertising & Consulting in the domain of Digital Marketing over the years. He relies upon his Digital Marketing learnings and uses the creative DNA for composing blogs that have the applied zeal to engage, entertain and inspire the readers- to Connect- Convince- Convert their target audiences via different digital media channels.

  • Digital-Marketing

  • Your Comment

    Your email address will not be published.

A rejoint le : 9 juin 2021
À propos

Customers can choose to use remote access that is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, or use Roadrunner's customer service phone number to connect with the company's customer services. You can contact us for the "settings for Roadrunner email". Our expert technicians are available 24 * 7 for your assistance.

Plus d'actions

When you hire a Highly Capable Copywriter – what are you really getting…?

A real copywriter is a creative sales person behind a keyboard…at least they are if their head is screwed on.

…mind those rolling heads.

…Here, I’ll make a guess: you need a writer with a good understanding of psychology and of what drives people to buy – or drives people to go in one direction over another.

I wrote a book about that: Grab ’em by the vowels – I’d say it’ll give you a good sense that I know what I’m talking about – let me know if you want to flick through it…

…or see the results. Email me if you’d like to see the work I did that helped a startup take the lead in a race against the biggest finance institutions on our pretty planet…

…When you hire a highly capable copywriter, it’s not just about ‘words’. It’s about driving profit in your business…

Here’s another thing that can make a big difference: voice…

…when your website, and your other advertising and marketing materials, have a distinctive voice – a voice that really talks to people. Then people will feel a sense of ‘character’…they’ll feel they’re getting to know your brand, and they’ll feel comfortable with it. Your brand will be a natural choice for them…

This is one place I excel. I love nailing the voice for a brand.

Here’s a note from my client Jim Leszczynski:

“The voice is amazing. I have no idea how you were able to write something that sounds like it came from my mouth. I shared it with a few friends and they too said it was amazing how you captured ‘me’. You certainly have a talent for identifying something and giving it life through words.”

A note from my client Dawood Ghalaieny:

“Richard, One word. Perfect. This is Cellusys. You have captured it. Lets do it… ALL.”

And here’re some voices I built / am building …each page of blether is designed to generate specific feelings and motivations in people:

A voice for MagicFriends.

A snippet of the voice I’m building for RebuildingSociety.

A voice for Costa Rica Packet.

A voice for a rebrand of Woodie’s.

A voice for ITCore.

Voice for a technology/telecoms company.

Voice for Escher Technology.

Roadmaster brand language.

Voice for a fintech.

Voice for Ulster Bank.

A voice for Ms Brown, the M&M’s character.

…I think one of the biggest reasons I can do ‘voice’ well, is: I love doing it.

Solid principles of influence + a voice that really talks to people = something really effective.

Here’s another job I did that fits that bill:



My thinking with that campaign was to appeal to our ‘drive to nest’ – our family values; and to the hero within us: be the person who takes care of those things that might just save your child’s life…with the sound of a child’s voice as a powerful motivator.

…more to it than the more common ‘just shock them’ approach, which can feel less relevant to people.

Copywriting is not about words

It’s about words as tools. Words and visuals are one. A highly-capable copywriter who can also creative direct, art direct, and design – and who has a deep understanding of how the eye takes in words – a deep understanding of typography – and of how the ear takes in words…will make you buckets of cash.

You’ll see more about that here.

And it’ll be handy for you to know that I did the art direction and the design, as well as the copy, for every item on this page, and every item in my portfolio. Here – I’ll grab just one piece o’ art outa my portfolio:


I guess you’ll be looking for a copywriter who can bring hints of story to your advertising, too…

…because our brains are wired for story. That’s what perks us up. When your product is integral to a story we relate to, we can feel at home with it. It can become a part of our lives.

We don’t need to use recognisable ‘story structure’ in the copy. More importantly, story is about helping people feel ‘realness’. It’s not about lies. We build the story from truths. It’s about showing the people who are right for your business, a path that brings them to this thing that can help them (your product).

I use story in subtle ways, right through my writing.

Have a scoot around my site. See a sense of real in my writing? Stuff you can relate to? Story…?

Another thing you might want is easy-to-read copy, that feels kind of like a conversation…

…because ‘writerly’ stuff is about the words themselves…but you’re not selling words; you’re selling your product.

So here’s something that will get people involved in what you’re saying: we need to make your copy so people feel there’s a person behind the words: someone talking to them through the page or the screen… Bring people this feeling, and they will be open to the messages you want to give them.

Not every person who sells him or herself as a copywriter can bring you that feeling in their writing: the feeling of a conversation. In fact, most can’t.

How are you finding my writing, on that score?

“I was spellbound on how you can ‘talk’ with your words. What an awesome gift you have…”

…that’s what Rosemarie Robertson said about my work…

I’ve nattered on about the psychology of influence, voice, story, conversation…

…but what about how your product helps people?

We need to grab people and show them. Here’s something I bet you wouldn’t be able to ignore if it landed on your doormat. It throws you right into the proof of why the product is good: it doesn’t give ‘doubt’ any opportunity to take hold in your mind.

A job I did for UPC:


“You want to know what a truly world-class, no-excuse, no-BS copywriter ought to be able to do? It’s this: He ought to be able to write an ad that tells how good he is. Hell, if he can’t sell himself, how can you expect him to sell your goods or services.” – Gary Halbert

…you’ve probably seen other copywriters’ web pages – you’ve seen what those people can do with words; or what they can’t do…

Now how about my words – do they show you something…? Did you almost forget you were reading? …so your mind was simply taking in the messages…

If you are thinking Yes, you might want to think: do these words show you this: you’ve found a writer who can bring the minds of your customers to…

…to an idea. To a place. Or to a click you want them to make…

If you want to ask me if I will help you with your project, you can catch me here:


If I don’t get back to you within a few days, maybe your email went into my spam folder. If you need to check I got your email:

Phone or text: +353 87 357 4031


PS: I am a highly capable copywriter. For us to work together, you will need a reasonable budget for the job, and I will need to be interested in the job: not just the budget – the job.

If you ask me to go ahead with a job, you are telling me you need a voice in your copy that really talks to people; that you need solid psychology that encourages people to think in specific directions; and hints of story that show people: this product is the one for you.

To fix a time to talk, or to see my portfolio:


Talk soon.



Or find me at:


+353 87 357 4031

Skype id: RichardClunan

...or sling a pigeon my way.

Forum Reputation
  • Your Forum Reputation: 0
Reputation is calculated like so:
  • - Number of posts you've written
  • - Number of thanks you've received for useful posts
  • - How long you've been a member
  • - How active you are (how often you log in, how often you view attachments, etc)
Reputation is relative to other members, so if you don't write many posts your reputation will be 0 or near 0.

You will reach Market Wizard level once your reputation is equal to about the top 5% of the highest reputation members, and you've been a member for over one year, and have written more than 500 posts.

You will earn the Legendary status once your reputation is above 100. Only the top 1% of posters earn this status.

This is a profile image of Olivier Denecker

Olivier Denecker

Partner, Brussels

Advises clients across the payments value chain, from transaction banks and central banks to digital attackers, payments processors, and merchants


Olivier is the director of knowledge for payments, serving our global clients on a wide variety of payment- and card-related topics. He has worked in the payments area since joining McKinsey in 1999, advising clients on their complex issues and managing payments-related projects and workshops.

Olivier's recent client projects include:

  • assisting a Northern European card-processing utility with the redesign of its product and services offerings across regions
  • helping a Southeast Asian banking association develop a national plan to accelerate the digital-payment evolution
  • leading major due-diligence efforts for top merchant acquirers and global payment-hardware specialists in Europe, Latin America, and the Middle East
  • supporting a European telecommunications player and a Northern European media specialist within the development of new digital-payment strategies
  • helping domestic payment-infrastructure players in several countries outline a strategic response to international payment developments

Olivier is also deeply involved in McKinsey’s payment and transaction-banking knowledge development, leading efforts on the profitability of markets, digital solutions, and regulatory trends. He is considered by many to be a key influencer in the industry and is a visible presence at high-profile conferences. He also serves on the editorial board of the firm’s McKinsey on Payments publication, to which he is a frequent contributor.

Published work

The future of payments in the Middle East,” McKinsey & Company, August 2021

Accelerating winds of change in global payments,” McKinsey & Company, October 2020

How payments can adjust to the coronavirus pandemic—and help the world adapt,” McKinsey & Company, March 2020

The digital battle that banks must win,” McKinsey & Company, August 2014

“Reinventing market infrastructures,” Putting Growth Back on The Banking Agenda, Sibos, September 2013

Tomas Almgren

  • Partner
Photo of Tomas Almgren


As part of the team that founded the Swedish operations more than eight years ago I have, together with the other team members of Clearwater International Sweden, built the most successful M&A boutique in Sweden. Our success is built on a combination of thinking outside the box combined with hard work and always putting the client’s needs first.

Today I am Managing Partner at Clearwater International Sweden and I advise Swedish and international clients on a variety of M&A transactions - primarily focused on sell-side mandates for both industrial and private equity clients.

My core strength has always been complex transactions where there has been a need to find innovative solutions to meet specific clients needs.

Some key deals include advising the founder on the divestment of IsaDora to Axcel; advising Latour on its sale of Specma Group to Schouw; advising on the sale of Diamorph to Epiris; advising Transdev Group on its sale of Flygbussarna (Airport coaches); and advising Accent Equity on its sale of Stål & Hyr Group.
